remixlab.proscene

Interface Model

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Grabber
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    GenericModel<E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GenericModelObject, InteractiveFrame, ModelFrame, ModelObject

    public interface Model
extends Grabber
    A model is a drawing (e.g., PShape or function-object procedure) wrapper Grabber. It may thus be manipulated by any Agent, such as the GrabberScene.motionAgent() or the GrabberScene.keyboardAgent().

    A model is selected using 'ray-picking' with a color buffer (see Scene.pickingBuffer()). For an implementation, see ModelObject.checkIfGrabsInput(float, float) or InteractiveFrame.checkIfGrabsInput(float, float). Note that the drawing could thus take place at least into the Scene.pg() and the Scene.pickingBuffer(), see draw(PGraphics).

    Third-parties should implement the Grabber behavior. A InteractiveFrame provides default 2D/3D high-level interactivity.

    One of the main motivations behind Models is an attempt to cover needs such those discussed here.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean draw(PGraphics pg)
      While displaying a model requires the drawing to be rendered into Scene.pg(), picking requires it to be rendered into Scene.pickingBuffer() (see Scene.drawModels() and Scene.drawModels(PGraphics), resp.).

      • Methods inherited from interface remixlab.bias.core.Grabber

        checkIfGrabsInput, performInteraction

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        boolean draw(PGraphics pg)
        While displaying a model requires the drawing to be rendered into Scene.pg(), picking requires it to be rendered into Scene.pickingBuffer() (see Scene.drawModels() and Scene.drawModels(PGraphics), resp.).

        For an implementation refer to the ModelObject and InteractiveFrame classes.

        Returns true if succeeded and false otherwise.

        Parameters:
        pg - PGraphics buffer used to draw the PShape instance.
        See Also:
        Scene.drawModels(), Scene.drawModels(PGraphics)
